MVfYw1BBabgr_4ptsbbdTw.text: The 222 BURGER for about a tenner including chips and home made ketchup is THE BEST in London. Go there.. Go there now!!

pTr5yNjf4o4ymokPyZNxiw.text: A little hard to get to by public transport, it's well worth the trek. A bright, clean and smart small restaurant. Lunchtime is an all you can eat buffet (check website for latest prices)  pot luck in what will be there on any day but I've always found all the food to delicious! There is a choice of several hot dishes and several cold/salad dishes  I usually manage three platefuls and am then completely stuffed  in a nice way! The chef is very experienced and very talented. In the evening it's a full menu (at higher prices)  I've yet to try this yet.

0VDor-YWSPD9UA28xqE5Rg.text: We loved this little place.  It was our first meal in London back in October.  Nice variety, very tasty and excellent service.  Wish we could find someplace as good stateside. I recommend the avocado and cashew salad and the quinoa.

T7jik6aOqb5Jx7SsIEjmAw.text: The food is good and the lunchtime buffet is good value for money -  it is worth booking at the weekends.

-1fVyFkNYkXclIoFgjkVnQ.text: After waiting an hour and a half for our meal we decided to leave. I've never experienced such horrible service in my life. The staff was rude and underwhelmed. The entire dining room was waiting without food. The waiter never came back to offer and more drinks during our wait and when we asked for an update on the wait after 90 minutes we never got a response. The worst service I have ever experienced in London!  Go to Mildred's in Soho instead.

xnyI7_OGwPn6DNYGuYv8zw.text: Had a great healthy lunch here before going to a Chelsea match. I would go back in a heartbeat.

u04MoMxKhm4jRjoERkRtQg.text: UPDATE: 22-feb 2012... We went back for lunch buffet today and the quality of the food had plummeted. The place was almost completely empty, so word's got round. A vile mini selection of horrid damp looking offerings, tepid, flavourless. It was embarrassing , actually and very disappointing.So..from five stars to one. I'd give it no stars if I could. Maybe the dinner's better.Below is my original review:I've been sitting in the traffic in front of this restaurant for years now and today, at lunchtime, I finally tried it.Buffet lunch. On one side, cold stuff like coleslaw and salads, the other side, curried chick peas and a bunch of other stuff that doesn't sound so great but is ( I mean curried chickpeas doesn't exactly make you want to run into the street and shout: 'TAXI! Take me to North End Road', does it?)I love buffet lunches. Love them. I wish there were more around here and I also wish there were more vegetarian places...but now I've discovered both in the 222.Nice clean, relaxed atmosphere, stripped wooden tables, white walls, water colours of flowers, I think...anyway, the real point of this review is to tell you how absolutely delicious and wonderful  and fresh and top notch quality everything was.The buffet lunch costs £7.50 and you can eat as much as you want, and it's not one of those eat as much as you can cram onto one plate scenarios, you can keep going back.

moc9O50-caoKf0jhtlAqDQ.text: My husband and I went to 222 tonight for dinner.  We live nearby and I've been wanting to try it for some time.  Today is my birthday so my husband made reservations for 7pm.  We turned up for 7pm and were seated right away.  It was busy but not entirely full.We waited about 10 minutes to order.  We ordered drinks, starters, mains and a side.  It got to 7.45pm and still no food had come.  No starters.  No word from the server why this might be happening.  Twice we tried to get her attention - once I even stood up and she made eye contact with me and kept walking (this place is quite small, seating 30 people or so, so it wasn't a matter of not seeing us).During the course of the 50 minutes that we waited for our food - some food, ANY food - another table was seated, ordered the same starter we did, ate it, ordered dessert, ate it, paid and left.  Another table of 6 was seated about 30 minutes after us, ordered starters and was served their starters.We finally gave up at 7.50 and asked to pay for our two drinks and said we were leaving.  It's a shame the service was so incredibly poor (and I was a little bothered because no one even came to our table to tell us what was going on) because I've really wanted to enjoy the food here for a while.I was shocked that our serve then decided to actually charge us for our two drinks (a juice and a soda) after all that.  I asked her why the other two tables had managed to get their food and we'd had nothing and was told because we'd ordered the raw avocado soup and raw took longer.  I would say, word to the wise don't order anything raw here if you want to eat, BUT the table that managed to eat and pay in the time we were waiting had the same soup!Possibly the worst service I've had ever anywhere.  Whether they were understaffed (appeared to be 2 servers for the restaurant) or not, the common courtesy to come to our table and tell us why our food was MIA would have at least given us the chance to order something else or make a decision to leave rather than sit around and waste an hour of my birthday dinner.  We ended up walking down North End Road to Del'aziz in Fulham and had a wonderful dinner with incredible service (they also have delicious vegetarian options).Oh, someone had a sense of reason and came out of the kitchen and told our server not to charge us for our juice and soda.  That was about the best they could do!My vote from now on will be to skip this place.

FjLOy5aafBqE7ZnKzXal5Q.text: The interior is a bit smaller and definitely less posh than the Website suggested, but nevertheless pleasant enough.  I've only had thelunch buffet, but it's both healthy and delicious: the hot offeringsare good and there's a variety of fresh salads.  The food it on thebland side, but it tasted good enough that I didn't try to find waysto heat it up.  At least for the lunch buffet, they make simple thingssimply, and succeed, unlike some cleverer places.

XogM0MaRCqB64R8iSzu4uA.text: WIthout doubt my favourite place to eat in london.

Fz4DpfbGHOpp7VvKbYnbzg.text: One of my favourite restaurants and I'm not even remotely vegetarian. The lunch buffet / take-away box is really good with a cold salad station & a hot food station. I tried their dinner for the first time today and the seitan stroganoff was amazing! Another great thing about 222 is that there are not a lot of complicated engineered vegan/vegetarian food (fake bacon, corned-beef Seitan, etc). The ingredients are straightforward enough and the food makes me very happy.

u3EIHF3vapaOymjL37uhzQ.text: People can get really down on vegan restaurants and although I'm a veggie I hardly ever eat at exclusively vegetarian restaurants because, you know, sometimes I don't want soya dairy and meat substitute. Despite the abundance of words like seitan, tofu, and soya cottage cheese on the menu this place is great. The flavours were amazing, an interesting blend of asian and afro-caribbean style food. I was with a carnivorous person who loved it too. We swapped dishes back and forth trying as much as possible but will definitely be back to sample other items on the menu. The only thing holding me back from giving 5 stars was the cost and the hideous organic wine (which is standard with organic wines).

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom

Kr2qDe3REaem0lmKE76P6w.text: This was, hands down, the best food I ate in London.  So good, in fact, I ate there twice.  We enjoyed a special holiday nut loaf, brussels sprouts cooked to perfection, a phenomenal parsnip-potato mash, a stroganoff, and a delightful pumpkin risotto. Definitely worth checking out if you want some delicious vegan food in London.  The service can be a little slow, but it's definitely worth the wait.

9zld4yQ0UdgIUlhwEJH2rg.text: Lucky lucky lucky. Just over road from holiday inn, which is basic! This veggie restaurant is exceptional. Busy clean, amazing menu. Have been twice in 24hours can't get enough. Highest award well deserved. Good value.

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Tofu Cheesecake
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Black Bean & Tofu Pancake
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Friendly Interior

IrOYHOU0bsYXYB-0aajHXA.text: Coming here from Santa Cruz, California I am use to having access to a variety of vegetarian restaurants.  This little gem would be high on my list of places to visit at home.  The food was very fresh and nicely prepared.  I was there for lunch which is served buffet style with a fixed price of £7.99 for as much as you want to eat from the fresh salad bar and warm food bar.  There were about five salads and five or six hot foods to choose from.  The salads included a delicious avocado salad with loads of creamy ripe avocado and an assortment of beans, seeds and greens.  Hot foods included brown rice, polenta, curried garbanzo beans, and a very nice selection of stir fried vegetables.  The restaurant is small with one waitress and the cook who appeared regularly to check on the food selection.  They were both very efficient and I had the feeling the food is prepared with love and a great deal of care.  Everything is vegan and most things are gluten free.  The food you get here is very healthy and tasty.  Although I didn't try them, the dessert selection looked very appetizing as well.I wish I was staying in London longer as I would love to return for more good food!

Eq0hvLk2mHZWAsgvep6KiA.text: Wow, what a wonderful surprise!  I was in the neighborhood to view a flat, and thanks to a miscalculation arrived half an hour early. I happened to be hungry; there was a random vegetarian restaurant with a reasonably-priced all-you-can-eat buffet; what did I have to lose?As it turns out, I wasn't merely pleased, but actually quite shocked by just how good the food was. Sumptuous. Refined. But in no way shy about the flavours, which were big and bold -- just the way I like it. I cannot imagine how it could have been better.Almost everything else was perfect, too: the decor was serene and pleasing, and the waitress was both gracious and sweet and efficient. The only minor blemish -- if I really press myself to find *something* negative to report, however trivial -- was that when I first walked in, I recall thinking that somewhat tacky music was playing. Any annoyance at the music, however, was thoroughly obliterated by the first bite of that exquisite food, and all was instantly forgiven. Seriously, it's good. I'll be dreaming of those curried chickpeas for weeks. If what the first reviewer says is true -- that the lunch buffet doesn't live up to the items on the menu, then I can't even *conceive* of how good those must be.Alas, the flat turned out to not to be the right place for me, which is a crying shame, because I'd love to live in the same neighborhood as this gem. In any case, I shall certainly return. I'm glad to see that others are raving about it as well -- 222 is a place that deserves to be known and loved.

uQcexEt8QLFaEZ4YJeJapg.text: Okay ... i have frequently gone into quite a bit of trouble for good, and different food.But almost everybody who knows me will agree that this one was the limit. What was i thinking ? Travelling 10 km across the city on a Saturday morning to have Vegan food. I didn't expect it of myself, and i won't repeat it ... the experience wasn't that good.Sure the lunch buffet was very cheap ... and the food wasn't too bad. But i didn't find it to be too memorable either. The organic wine and the non-dairy ice-creams, though good, were not good enough to force me to abandon their "normal" counterparts. I agree that the chickpeas curry was really nice (as mentioned in many of the other reviews), but if i ever have a craving for chickpeas, i would rather visit one of the hundred odd Indian restaurants between my apartment and 222.I had visited after seeing the great reviews this place had on yelp, and i was curious about trying seitan (haven't seen it anywhere closer). Unfortunately its available in the dinner menu and not in the lunch buffet, so i shall have to wait.The place had decent vegetarian food, and i can imagine that it would be very popular in a vegetarian unfriendly city like London ... but it just wasn't spectacular enough to convert me.

kotYXGjpx-cYjirzB-AoGg.text: Quite an average location, out of the way and the neighbouring shops and streets have a very average vibe. Its great that they have the vegan options and they certainly have great choice in that matter - I just felt the atmosphere was a bit bland. What a selection of cakes! However, when two of our party ordered the apricot and almond cake, the staff tried to serve banana cake instead. They ended up admitting they had no apricot cake and gave the banana cake for free, so it made up for it somewhat. I recommend the Samuel Smith organic beer, goes down a treat. And the pancake dessert was right 'n nice as well.

zgLUjb4J-6XfKVWxyzcs2A.text: sad recreations of meat based dishes drowning in watery sauces with soggy veg & bread.

dmujq_JFbAHUiKgtYff7MQ.text: I loved the food I ate here! As a vegan it was so exciting to be able to choose anything I like on the menu (although it took me ages to decide what to order as everything sounded so good!) The food is healthy as they do not use refined foods, unhealthy fats or any additives but certainly is not lacking in flavour! I ordered a pasta dish made with mushrooms in a cashew cream sauce, which was lovely. My friend also enjoyed her meal, which was the 222 burger, which came with oven baked chips and homemade ketchup! We didn't have room for dessert but will definitely try them next time as they sounded great!

fBdhoLLSlFdampt_vhf_EQ.text: Good food, nice atmosphere, amazing salads. I recommend the Seitan Stroganoff. The food is pricy, but well worth it. If you're on a budget the lunch buffet takeaway is a bargain, but the food is not as fantastic!

xNq_U3iD3fI8DvfP8lchFw.text: Nice place. Good buffet choices. Only downside: they want you to use your used plate to get seconds at the buffet - illegal in the US!

Ggf2mzLQWNDsRaWTs2R8Rg.text: Was staying close by for a work trip, I had takeaway coconut noodles (these are served cold so don't be surprised by that like I was - in a good way), they were so tasty that I rang and booked a table for the following evening.I am not vegan, but do try to eat a plant strong diet while at home usually giving up when eating out due to lack of options, 222 Veggie Vegan certainty go essential options.Service can be slow, but always with a smile and the food is worth the wait - nothing is deep fried so can take a little longer which is by no means a bad thing.Go with an open mind, take your time and enjoy!

3A1SXIhKqD57oud4awG1lg.text: This has to be the best family style restaurant in all of London (not just best vegan restaurant but best restaurant period). It was one of those places where you go and try a few different things and each one is just so so good which is really rare. Good service and delicious food - for anyone who thinks vegan food is "gross" guess again!

nUyysKPSL_GOwVCUfvSx4w.text: Lovely food. I'm not a vegan, but trying to eat healthy at the moment and this place ticked all the boxes in terms of service, food and location. Will definitely be back again.

Uq8Ux1yF4R3p1eWdoZP6gQ.text: Wow, and not in a good way. Came here for lunch on a Saturday and was quite excited given the reviews -  unfortunately it was a major disappointment.They were offering a lunch buffet which I generally enjoy but half the options were missing and those that were available were uninspired and bland particularly compared with other vegetarian options in the city. Nothing but an assortment of stir fry vegetables and pasta salads. The coffee was burnt and the service slow (even for a buffet). The meal was £7.50 each which is extortion given the options which is essentially a glorified salad bar.

agdBUjvGaAoYNec0KJghNw.text: I've been to 222 Vegan Cuisine (this is what they seem to be called now after the interior has received some retouching) quite a few times and must say both the all-you-can eat buffet and the evening menus have been delicious. The raw chocolate torte is to die for and the service has always been friendly. Well worth the effort if traveling from the other side of town!

ZLG2UgwwGk4CUwsrxaDylg.text: The lunch buffet is delicious!  I'm a meat eater, but we went to the buffet today for lunch and it was great!  The chickpea curry was very tastey, and every item on the buffet was flavorful.  My only complaint is the grilled bananas, which are usually some of my favorite foods, was a little chewy and old.Great lunch for a great price.

_Ln-bSueEweHDM3JkZLI7A.text: OMG!!! What a find! My girlfriend and I were staying directly across the street at the Holiday Inn Express and we spied this little treasure on our first night in London. She's vegetarian and I'm close so we were thrilled to find this spot.All I can tell you is EVERYTHING is good here. We must have eaten here at least 4 times in the course of 5 days. Not once were we disappointed. Everything was fresh and delicious. This is the type of vegetarian place you can take EVERYONE to, meat eaters included.  The food is well prepared, seasoned, and presented beautifully.The service was stellar as well. We had the same waitress on most visits and she was lovely. Friendly and helpful and always smiling. Ask her about her tattoo and tell her the girls from California said "Cheers!"

zIfs3P-0KrEoGr2HxzrBLw.text: Overpriced, but still delicious. We got the roast, and seitan stroganoff. The seitan was delicious, as was the sauce that came with the roast. The stroganoff sauce was great. We also got flatbreads and dips which were amazing. I'd hope to return, it's just a bit pricey for me.

3Nw_mnpdpqtAJ5bRt0jsvw.text: After wandering around London after work one cold evening, I managed to find myself in West Kensington and very near this restaurant (thanks helping me find it, Yelp).The restaurant  is cute and cozy - I went on a Monday evening so there were only three tables filled at the time. It was a nice way to spend a quite evening for dinner.Red lentil soup was really spot on - warm and filling, just a slight hint of spiciness to warm the soul. Very generous portion - really appropriate on a chilly fall in London.I haven't had a stroganaff in ages, so it was quite a treat to order the seitan stroganaff`as a main. The cashew cream sauce was delicious, and it went well with the with the brown rice. This was vegan comfort food at its best.For dessert, I'm a sucker for vegan deserts and The Spice Island Pie was raw, gluten/wheat free and completely yummy!I was able to get away with three courses and sparkling water for around £21.I'm looking forward to going back very soon!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom

HNtGVmbyrttsCJx6ppt4Ag.text: Hidden gem in Fulham areaTasty, original vegan food at a very fair price. We got the dish of the day which was carrot tart and veggies, and the wok with noodles. VERY generous portions. I take one star off because the service was very long, we waited more than 20min and it was not even packed. The dishes were so good though that we forgot about the wait as soon as we started eating!In a nutshell: might convince you to go vegetarian

Kbn0fARTVwAxtC5SPa0QqQ.text: First time here was amazing. The food was perfect (although the service was lackluster but given how crowded the place was this can be forgiven). The food was so good we came back for a 2nd time. Everything was perfect until we ordered dessert and my friend found a plastic tab in his ice cream. We politely and quietly informed our waitress who essentially shrugged it off, didn't even apologized. Feel like my friend should at least been comped for his dessert! I, myself, was so grossed out I didn't finish my dessert. No desire to go back now.

pO59Ud76Vzva1wboMsKq1Q.text: This vegan eatery is one of the most dependable places for food on the planet. You know what you are getting, everything is scrumptious and all the alcohol on the menu is vegan.But with dependable comes a little bit of predictability. I love everything on the menu but I do wish it would change up a bit now and then. Maybe I would go back more often if there were more dishes on rotation.One option at 222 I hope they never change is the weekend brunch. This wondrous array of breakfast foods is worth every star all on its own.222. Delicious and safe vegan food finery.

QHJe3o-qpTKnyebw-4sAag.text: Very very good food!I had the raclette which was inventive and yummy. My friends had the raw salad noodles (sooo tasty) and the roast (what you'd expect, presented well) and the large veggie burger.  Desserts were smooth and just as fab. Lovely service, great decor - slightly pricey but v pleased!

C1IT0mOsZFCOkI8rmFGLGw.text: After reading all the reviews, I have to admit I was a bit disappointed by the dishes served during the lunch buffet. Some of them were ok, and only one was really good. Still, will probably return to try them during dinner hours.

iBp4hi29YrXD0so7ErOcgQ.text: I've visited 222 Veggie Vegan twice in my visits to London - once to order a la carte, and once to try the lunch buffet - and neither disappointed!With everything being vegan, there's quite an overwhelming choice on the a la carte menu (especially when there's such a tempting dessert menu to try and leave room for). The kitchen dishes out some inspired food, a far cry from many samey brown veg options you'll find elsewhere - vegetables are highlighted, flavours stand out, and there are a good variety of proteins on offer (seitan, tofu, legumes). A number of dishes are Carribean-inspired, but there are also salads, a burger and pasta dishes that have their own unique appeal.If you still have room, make sure you try the pancake and ice cream for dessert - it's just fantastic.Although the lunch buffet is simpler, there is still a decent range of hot foods and cold salads to feast on, all of which are just as well-made and flavoursome as the a la carte offerings. I found it great because it allowed me to try a little of everything to see what I enjoyed most, and then go back for some more.Despite 222 Veggie Vegan being a little off the beaten path due to not being smack bang in the middle of central London, it's well worth a visit. Staff are friendly and helpful, and the dining experience is a relaxed and enjoyable one.

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Lunch buffet selection

YKsiMam8CQfY8BEzg1eN_A.text: Ben, thank you for being so phenomenal in the kitchen -- my favorite vegan dining spot in London! I've been here several times and have thoroughly enjoyed it, albeit service is a bit slow, but it just makes my moments with friends more enjoyable.The staff is totally sweet and the decor of the restaurant is warm, sets a nice atmosphere where one can just relax.The chips are delicious and I never leave without having the 222 pancake. GET THE PANCAKE, it's like heaven...I promise that you won't regret it. I always get it with an extra serving of chocolate ice cream and am always delighted when it's set down before me...my eyes just light up at the sight of a pancake that's drenched in chocolate and vanilla sauce, but the most orgasmic thing is when I take the first bite...oh my, if I had a boyfriend I would choose this over him any day -- so amazing!My visits have always rotated between these: avocado pomodoro, 222 gardens, 222 burger, and pasta with wild mushrooms. Can't venture far from these, my heart is set! I had my first elderflower drink here and have always ordered it since (though the smoothies are delicious), it complements my meal as it is light and has the perfect touch of fragrant sweetness. Can't wait to try out the buffet, midday grubbing before shopping? Count me in!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom

E-4evtHEu_WUFqli-e8xcw.text: We arrived for dinner sans reservation on UK Mother's day, but the busy staff was incredibly kind and allowed us to wait for a table- even going so far as to breaking a small table off for us, from a string inhabited by a large party who lost some diners late in the meal.  The food was fresh and delicious; the portions generous.  Definitely worth the long wait.

3xfuCEFIMCoS4nyEm9lBoA.text: I loved my visit to 222 Veggie Vegan- and I'm not vegetarian OR vegan!  Although their menu is not huge in number of selections, it is diverse and I found myself struggling to make a decision.  I landed on the Indian lentil soup to start and I was so happy I did!  So delicious and flavorful and the portion is huge.  For an entree I went for Ben's Special w/ noodle- a hearty and flavorful stir fry.  Everything was fresh and delicious.The one server for the dining room was incredibly sweet and very kind even when I spilled my wine at the table.An amazing value, delicious food, great staff- perfect experience and I'm sure to go back.

3y3UkMX6YQ1ND2FdbeGH8Q.text: The bf and I happened to be in Earls Court, so thought we'd give this place a try. I ordered what was apparently a customer favourite: Seitan Stroganoff. Holy crap, that was tasty! I can imagine going there JUST for that. The bf ordered the spinach and avocado salad, which had a sesame dressing on it. I love sesame dressing, so I was all over that. Pretty decent and a small menu, but I think it's a good place to check out if you're in the area. I'd love to go back and try more.

ZhWTiq3_ffeW8-bhT8gPIA.text: Booked an 8 pm table much in advance. Was made to wait till 0845 and the waiter was extremely rude. He even lied saying that you were called on your mobile and there was no response when there were no missed calls on my phone. The food was ok.

sI6XSz6an2fLcM4N7IWW6g.text: Went to this place last week. The food is pretty reasonable. It is slightly pricey but is nice and tasty. BIG WARNING FOR THOSE WHO PLAN ON VISITING. We had a reservation for 4 people. Upon reaching on time - we were told that they were overbooked and cannot offer a spot for thirty minutes. It was fairly annoying, however, we decided to walk around for the time. On returning we were told to wait for a further 15 minutes. When we objected - the server started to raise his voice and lied about trying to call us and inform us about a table that had cleared up a little while back. It is a fairly small restaurant and no table of four had a new audience. We had a very unpleasant experience at the door, however, the quality of the food salvaged the two stars above.

o62L7CS2xGv8bOA_KUaOFA.text: 1st impression: tables are VERY close together and it was a bit warm and stuffy. They squeezed me between two tables that were tiny and literally pushed up on either side of mine. I could barely sit down without bumping the people on either side of me, and I'm not big. The waitstaff seemed flustered and had a hard time setting food on these tables as they were so close together and near the cash register/kitchen walkway. I got the appetizer of artichoke hearts, which they brought before bringing my drinks. I reminded the waiter and he brought my drinks right away. The artichoke hearts were cooked perfectly and tasted fresh; they were served on sautéed spinach leaves and a tiny smear of some bland condiment. There was zero seasoning and I got bored of it halfway through. For my main I had the seitan stroganoff which is apparently the customer favorite. Again, it was bland and lacked a depth of flavor. I ate half and grew bored of searching for flavor that wasn't there. The glass of white wine I ordered was not good. I took a risk and ordered dessert which was the only redeeming quality of the meal. I ordered the chocolate gateau and a glass of red wine. These were delicious and paired together so well; I would go back again just for dessert.  tl;dr mehhhhh....just get dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom

F3L_axmwcquzcVnzINRZyA.text: Don't book a large group at this restaurant. The food is great, however within ten minutes of the booked reservation we were met with a barrage of questions about the arrival time of our guests. Is it unreasonable to have a half an hour window? If they don't like big bookings maybe they shouldn't have taken it. I personally, did not want to deal with their stress, on my birthday with friends. My wife had booked a table of 16, we had told them two people were not coming immediately. Four more did not show, which we informed them about by half an hour in. The Front of house supervisor was rude to my wife on first confrontation. Not really an acceptable attitude. Friends enjoyed their meals and all the food was great as I said earlier, a little more consideration, would not have gone a miss though.

7uepp93xGEVboiglUr4QAw.text: I was recently vacationing in London and found this gem within walking distance of our hotel. I absolutely loved the lunch buffet - one of my favorite meals in London. The spinach tarts were particularly tasty, but I really enjoyed everything I tried. My meat loving partner said it was the best vegan food he's ever had and said he'd eat there twice a week if it was in our hometown. This place is small! Consider making a reservation and prepare to be cozy with your dining neighbors. Reasonably priced, clean and nicely decorated for being a small space, and friendly service. Please come to the US 222 Vegan!

dalkre1ZktlQR4KTSWdg9w.text: Ate here last year and had terrible service unfortunately. They must have have extremely under staffed. We waited an hour for our food and was not even offered an apology or anything. Food was boring and overpriced for what it was. Would not return.

vqQrxnTBIYggjT9Jwn__ZA.text: This is a wonderful restaurant!  I'm not a vegetarian,  but I could be if all my meals tasted like this.  The stroganoff was spectacular.   Our waiter was really friendly and helpful.  We'll be back!

y8VwG6g0GC3Vt3hCpIttkQ.text: There is a lot to like about this place.This is a clear five star place if you like vegan desserts. Most vegan desserts are macrobiotic masochism pretending to be a sweet.These vegan desserts are pure decadent pleasure -Vegans who don't get a lot of desserts because they can't consume milk will be in nirvana.It also has a very very cool crowd.And a few of the main dishes are ok. (Kudos to the curried chickpeas).So why only three stars?Most of the non-dessert menu is pure good-for-you-blah.Vegetables are colorful - crunchy enough to have their nutrients preserved -and totally tasteless.Enjoy your vitamins because you won't necessarily be enjoying your meal.And the place is so crowded it is not comfortable to sit, relax, or even stand up to go to the buffet or go to the toilet.It is somewhat like eating vegetarian food in a Japanese subway.Now - fair is fair - it is crowded because lots of Baron's Court folks love the place.And there is nothing like it in the neighborhood.But if you want really good vegetarian food, there are so many veggie indian places - so many great turkish mezze places and so many good small scale health fooderies,that you don't have to settle for nutritious and boring.(Unless - of course - you want dessert - heh heh)Then the calculations change.

CxN4MhVYIn_il3dCIobyUw.text: The lunch buffet will satisfy you and leave you full.  I tried all the items on the all-you-can-eat buffet, and they were all delicious.  I especially loved the spinach tart and the broccoli in creamy sauce.  The pumpkin and beetroot salad was interesting and something I had never tried before, although a little on the salty side.  The mashed potatoes and parsnips and chickpea stew were also delicious.  I ordered the 222 Pancake for dessert and it was lovely, although I barely had any room for dessert at that point!  I would go back here on subsequent visits to London.  Also good for to-go meals.

vDNcbII9gKeOVV6qtnwVaA.text: Delicious and great value! Had lunch there this week and everything tasted fresh. Good variety for the lunch buffet. Some warm food and some cold salads. Scrumptious broccoli in pumpkin sauce. Highly recommended.

Tg6T3Sewi0KvPDoGcE8GNw.text: So delicious. Lots of options, daily specials, knowledgable staff, and truly fresh & gourmet. Cannot recommend highly enough!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom

XfOP5BhBey-KZMzSngR4dw.text: You simply won't find better vegetarian and vegan food in West London for this price range. It's an easy walk from West Brompton or West Kensington. It's a bit small, so if you're coming some distance you should probably make reservations. They don't have a lot of room.The dishes are inventive and interesting and thoroughly veggie and vegan. You'll find raw food options, too. It is clear that they want to thrill the vegetarians, not just please them. I struggle every time i come. The lure of dishes I know well competes with my desire to try new things. My friend from America got Ben's Special (a dish I usually get) and ordered it spicy. It was proper spicy and he was sweating (in a good way)I've eaten here many times over the years and am shocked I haven't reviewed it yet. I even had them make platters of food for a party once, and it was all the talk of my guests.The service is standard English service. Not quite as attentive as Americans might like, but friendly and gets the job done. Really, you go for the food, not the service. And you won't be disappointed.

u1Wf0fUFQ4Q1SUiaQIi61g.text: This place was amazeballs!!!  Took my daughter to celebrate her Sweet16 and this was our first time in London!  She's a vegan and thought everything was delicious!  Our server was Ben and he was funny and had great customer service!  We all thoroughly enjoyed the dishes.  They even brought out a slice of cake with a candle when they heard it was her birthday. Fabulous!!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. The whole restaurant sang happy birthday to my daughter. She loved it!!
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Birthday girl being silly! #crosseyed
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Nommyness!!

zUwNP72tmqvgAN5WgdNy-w.text: Love love this place. I popped in for take-away from the lunch buffet and was not dissappointed. I basically had a bit of everything that I could smash into a tiny box for £5.50 and I was a very happy girl for it. The carrot quiche cakes were superb. The salads were great, the chickpea stuff was good. It was ALL GOOD. I can't wait to go back!

GGV5LtWgfbJSu05JqgPK3g.text: This was the second vegan place I tried in London during my holiday and I love the food!!! The buffet style is awesome because you get to try everything. There was not one thing I did not like. I look forward to going back the next time I am in London.

hy7weQY_5r6I-53DzG88WQ.text: This is my favorite vegan buffet as well as restaurant in London.  Amazing and go for lunch.  Dinner is also great.  If you are a vegan or vegetarian in London you could do no wrong to go here.  My first trip to London I didn't know where to go.  I thought the food was rubbish to NYC and San Francisco.  Latter I discovered this gem of a place on Happy Cow.  222 Veggie Vegan proved me wrong that London does great food and great vegan food.  They coined the term vegan.  England gave us vegans, the Smiths, the Beatles, and Joy Division.  Not bad and love London!

HfBRy10t6L6v0dCqbzZGcA.text: Such a lovely place! Vegan all you can eat just sounds like heaven to me. The food is fresh and I really like the seasonings they used in their dishes I wish I wasn't so full to try the dessert they look so delicious! Got to go back .

AFnodGx2QLz7im9nKUVoLw.text: My family took me here for my birthday, and I've got to say, I couldn't have been ANY happier.  Even my non-vegetarian hubby and vegetarian daughter were happily full!!! They BOTH said that they wanted to go back!!! We had drinks, appetizers, sides, mains and they even wonderfully brought me out a birthday dessert!!!The table was even decorated for my birthday!! In any case, if you have a chance, GO! It does not matter who you are, this place will fill you up with delicious and healthy food.

Oe5kKvYIQkjV-QzT41SNLg.text: One of my favourite places in London, without any doubt. In fact, couple of times we had to go back disappointed because we didn't reserve the seats and the place was full, but instead of getting angry, we felt happy for them that they are doing well :-)They serve buffet for lunch and A La Carte for dinner, we have tried both and liked equally. For regular visits, buffet seems more attractive as the cost is less, but we really liked their A La Carte also. There are very limited vegan all-you-can-eat buffets in London, and this is the only one we found where the spread is quite healthy as well.The place is bit small, and menu options could seem a bit limited, but hey, we would still rate this as one of the best places.

pZKglK1WO5p6BJnRFu1ifg.text: Why is it that one only discovers the gems in a local neighbourhood just as one is about to leave it? 222 Veggie Vegan is an 5 star joint however I look at it. It's super-cheap, for one: £7.50 for the all-you-can-eat lunch buffet is incredible value, particularly when one considers the 'pay-per-weight' policy usually applicable to vegetarian places (e.g. Tibits). Second, the quality and variety of food is really good. The cold salads include tomato and lettuce, avocado and spinach and red cabbage, while the hot dishes centre around chickpeas, polenta, potato and most memorably, plantain.There's quite a bit on the menu beyond the lunchtime buffet too: a couple of organic beers (the pretty decent Sam Smiths organic lager and the rather average Freedom organic lager), smoothies and unexpectedly delicious organic, fairtrade coffee. There are desserts too: my eyes were instinctively drawn to the wholewheat pancake that I was too stuffed to try, but made a mental note of for next time.And finally, the atmosphere here is great, with a truly representative mix of locals to be found here. And on laid-back, diverse, unpretentious, friendly North End Road that's a good thingSeriously, I am gutted that in 5 weeks time I'll be living 20 minutes cycle ride from this place rather than the 3 minutes walk that I currently do. But I fully expect to be making the trip on a regular basis regardless.

ypEuSsK7r1ndq3IztxzSPw.text: Mushroom stroganoff was excellent!With the quinoa unbelievable!My digestive system is in love with your menu!Thank you for and excellent healthy meal!

txK1U0AL0QwcFf2LUqhsLA.text: Highly recommend the stroganoff and artichoke hearts. The smoothies are very flavorful.It's a nice atmosphere and attentive staff. I recommend reserving a table as it is full by 730 on a weeknight. Meal with starters and smoothies for 2 was £50z

3-L1H1nA7g8Wea_a-A8SYg.text: The food was pretty good, and the service was friendly, but the amount of time it takes to get your food here is simply inexcusable. Even if meals are made from scratch, the management needs to have a better system - or diners should be warned ahead of time just how long a meal is going to take. We made reservations for 5:30pm, and when we arrived, a table was waiting for us. There was only one other party at the time we were seated. We ordered our appetizer and entrees, and then the wait began. It took close to an hour to even get the appetizer. I let the server know that we were on a bit of a time crunch, as we had plans after that required us to be out at a specific time (6:45, not a minute later). The server was very nice about it, and she kept talking with the kitchen to let them know the situation, but it wasn't really a successful venture. We finally received our entrees around 6:40pm (and that was after multiple "conversations" with the kitchen to speed it up), so we had very little time to eat. We weren't even able to get out of the restaurant on time, despite it all. We actually paid our check before the food even came, and the server felt so bad that she gave us a 10% discount on the check. The food was good, but I had such little time to enjoy it that I can honestly barely remember it enough to decide whether it was among the better vegan dishes I had on my trip to London. Even more disappointing, we had no time to try any of the desserts, which was one thing that had persuaded us to check out this restaurant in the first place.My advice for visiting this restaurant is to make early reservations, don't come incredibly hungry, and be prepared to spend the entire evening there. This is not the place for a meal before a special event or a show, even if you give yourself what seems like plenty of time.

mlZqI5F2VBIG2Wvk8fKgmg.text: It was a super positive experience to dine at 222 Veggie vegan in London, Kensington.I ordered the seitan medallions with gravy and mash and it was on point. Service was quick and they menu has lots of good options. My mother had the stir fry which she loved.We will definitely revisit this place if we come back to London.

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Seitan medallions

X2P9vT2yM8wCyiT2VJrslA.text: Food was great. If I lived here, I would come back but was extremely disappointed by how understaffed they were. It took forever just to get water (we were almost done with our meals before they gave us water). And, we kept asking for soy milk for our coffee but never got it. For a restaurant of that size, they should have more waiters and waitresses.

Gvx0vlUD0rIO4nms9fclYw.text: Food was just ok. Certainly not worth the 75+ minute wait for food for a party of 2!   3 other couples were served before us.  Our server never checked on us or apologized.  We made reservations and received an email confirmation, but when we arrived, we were told no table was ready for us. I would not dine here again.  Ok food.  High priced.  Crappy service.  I would rate them less than a 1 if possible.  There are better options for the money, food quality and experience.

gHcd5Qa1lEd_kCYML3Db-Q.text: During my stay in London, I tried to go eat to as many vegan/vegan friendly places as I could. Once finding out about this one, my best friend and I loved it. This was the day of our flight so we had our backpacks with us. A kind young woman, offered to put our bags in the back so we can have some space. That was nice of her. I forgot her name. The buffet was small but the food was incredible. I love that things aren't fried, they're baked. The quality is great. We had two big plates of food. We also got an apple crumble for dessert and that was amazing. My best friend isn't vegan and I was anxious to see if she'd like the food and she loved it! Win win! When I go back to London I'm going back to this place. Cheers!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Buffet of goodness

ZC3UUn61E8wNUF0O_y1lKw.text: The best vegan AND gluten free food I've ever had. They are super aware and careful regarding all major allergens! For the deliciously fresh and flavorful quality of this food, you just can't beat the price for the lunch buffet... 11.50 pounds if you eat there or 9.50 to go, all you can eat!!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. 222 pancake dessert
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Lunch buffet
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Lunch buffet

9uWVQqdljayv9nkROve3WA.text: This review is for the chocolate cake + vanilla ice cream dessert!!! The best I've ever had (vegan)!  I think Nobody on earth would ever need to take a non-vegan dessert if they all tasted like this! :)

L9t40yB-wuGhEXSAH_TuUQ.text: What a great find! My husband and I searched for "vegan" on Yelp and found this restaurant. So glad we did - family run with fresh, organic, made to order plant based delights. Ben was so kind and welcoming and helped start us in the right direction when ordering. He told his that his father, also named Ben, started the restaurant in 2004 having been vegan for decades, way before much was known about it. Pictured are the risotto - amazing and creamy! (Made with cashew cream), almond/apricot cake a la mode and the raw spice cake (quite spicy but very tasty!) We loved it so much we are going back tomorrow night. Make a reservation just in case - it gets crowded. We saw people coming in a steady stream during the 2 hours we were there. Enjoy and make sure you meet Ben!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom

c2ew9at0bPfS1u1q9yH9kw.text: One of the best vegan restaurant I have ever tried! Cozy little place. The staff is polite and very helpful.Great choice of food and great quality.Not far from earl's court station, this place has to be visited. My artichokes were absolutely delicious and my main course was simply fantastic.The price are affordable and the atmosphere lovely.

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Seitan stroganoff
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Artichokes

3DogP9xga9UW7J8qAatZUQ.text: When I was in London and Copenhagen, I biked and walked everywhere. Biking and walking in London is probably as maddening as walking in Los Angeles sometimes. The grid patterns of our roads are like shattered glass. Blame the medievals for London and blame the oil barons for LA but the ups and downs and turns made going to vegan buffets really delectable (and economical if you're a pig like me). Some of the favourites foods of mine included quinoa, their plantains (without potatoes), avocado salad and cold cashew cream salad. The quinoa is nice and hot and perfectly cooked. The plantains offered a great flavour and wish they were served on their own. A Yelp friend of mine Jessica T. once wrote on Yelp that she prefers to indulge in carbs that delight her tastebuds, not dull them. I find that to be something to live by, which is why I don't usually eat potatoes when other more flavourful carbs are offered. The cold cashew cream salad was incredibly delicious and had a great creamy consistency. And fresh avocados in any salad always win.The cooks began changing the food at 12:30pm (they open at 12pm) so that was a very great sign that the food was incredibly fresh. I am never in this area when I am in London. It is more west than most of the vegan places here, near the West Kensington tube. But it was definitely worth coming to when I was on the way to Heathrow. For those whose phones are perpetually out of battery life, they have outlets next to many of the tables too!

Wz9FhgzmgJLhAJ8jqjX4KQ.text: I've been coming here for about four years and even though timing of food delivery is better than other days you can't get past the fact that the food is AMAZING.  If you plan on getting here after 7pm, make a reservation.  The place fills up fast.  There is wifi and places to plug in at half of the tables. My favorites... pumpkin soup, beet salad, spinach raclette, the stroganoff, the risotto, and desert the pancake.

naG8RUoOqLb4x66UlQ7wcA.text: Amazing food. Incredibly low prices. I can't believe this place isn't packed full. Wine is SO cheap. Food is SO good. I am coming back before the end of my trip!!!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom

F54UyQgACz5Q0_xQaVo_rQ.text: I must say that 222 Veggie Vegan has been one of the best vegan restaurants I have discovered so far in London. As I'm not from here, I've been hopping from restaurant to restaurant not wanting to go to a single place twice, but I will definitely have to return to this location!The staff were amazingly friendly, the food was top notch, and it was a very happy, light and airy atmosphere that I fell in love with.The lunch buffet was a very reasonable price of £9.50 and I definitely think it was worth it!

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Vegan ice cream: chocolate, vanilla and raspberry

cFQ7JRBonpX3sj6kYGwBlw.text: I went for lunch on a rainy Monday, and the buffet made braving the weather so worth it! Such a great deal for AYCE vegan food. There wasn't anything I didn't like; standouts included the cold bean/eggplant salad and the various stews/curries. Service was friendly and attentive. My only criticism is that the food was a bit on the salty side. This could just be a personal preference, but the man dining next to me also said it was too salty for his taste. However, 222 Veggie Vegan and its lunch buffet was wonderful, and I will definitely be back!

YeY6az3yqOkM0eb4guSEmg.text: I'm not a vegan/vegetarian but on a whim I went with two friends because we were close by and hungry. I was pleasantly surprised! Two of us shared the avocado soup which was pretty good and not too thick/heavy. I had the vegan roast with the seitan and it was excellent. I would definitely come back here and recommend it to others. The others I was with had Ben's special and the stroganoff plates, which they also said were very filling and delicious! It wasn't tooo expensive for what we got (60 pounds for 3 mains + 1 starter soup + 1 bottle of wine). If you're interested in trying vegan food, I'd try it out :)

OOkOKL1xIxcVCYCTnL8oMQ.text: I'm ending a 9-day trip to the U.K., and I had my best meal of the trip here! I loved my main dish - potatoes with an almond cream sauce, garlic, onions, and a salad. The dessert pancake (with chocolate, ice cream, and more) was, surprisingly, not too sweet. The ice cream, in particular, was delicious.

VBAXgGT-urST2ejEmtfJhA.text: Solid vegan food at this place. I've been here once before, when I had some sort of pumpkin dish and was bowled over. This time around, on Sunday night, whilst not l  the dishes were phenomenal, they were still very good. I got the raw avocado soup which was incredibly creamy and a large portion. The flavour of cashew is apparent in the soup and is a perfect complement to the avo. I also got the bean and tofu pancakes (black-eyed beans and tofu stuffed in two wholemeal wraps with a vegan cream sauce). These were ok... didn't blow me away. The dish needs a greater kick. I also got the pumpkin and courgette noodles with coconut and chopped Brazil nuts in a lime/ginger sauce, and the spiced almond cake, for takeaway. I had the noodles for lunch today and they are amazing due to the sauce. I could eat that ALL the time. The dessert is incredibly soft and crumbly with a tasty blend of nuts and spices. It looks like and has somewhat the texture of cheesecake but is WAY better. And oh yeah I had a smiling and helpful waitress (!!!!)

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom

HYP0fL0IkLj65PpBVFBJuQ.text: Visited this little hidden gem when we were in London a few weeks ago. Most of the menu is vegan and everything sounded so good. Ten minute walk from our hotel too... Result! The decor is simple and clean looking, nothing fancy. They do a vegan buffet during the day, but we were visiting at night. Had heard wonderful things about their stroganoff, so already knew I was going for this. Seitan strips, caramelised onions, fresh herbs and pepper cubes in cashew cream, served with organic brown basmati rice. This dish was beautiful! Had a lovely, refreshing glass of white wine to wash it down. Service was pretty fast, given that the waitress had just started working there and was being trained along the way. She was really friendly too.The menu is impressive, I could have ordered everything from it. We only went for main courses as we were a little pushed for time. They have a very small selection of raw vegan dishes too, as well as desserts. Not the cheapest place to eat, with my main alone coming in at £11, but everything tasted so fresh and well seasoned. Wouldn't hesitate to go back.

photos.caption: Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Spinach tart with sauteed potatoes, vegetables and sauce
Photo of 222 Veggie Vegan - London, United Kingdom. Seitan stroganoff
